name: O.C.B.
overview: OCB or Original Casse Brique is … a brick breaker (as its name suggests, a name that has absolutely no connection with the cigarette paper of the same name ..) with some particularities: Have a "world" editor: you can create your own "world" with the number of levels you want, with the parameters of your choice: ball speed, visual effects, size of the playing area,... The possibility of playing in pairs, in challenge mode, that is to say opposed to each other, thereby offering a kind of "combat" mode where opponents enjoy bumping into bumper cars, to poke the ball,… Have a playing area larger than the screen (follow the trajectory of the ball, but don't worry, despite the disappearance of the puck from the screen, an indication still shows its position) Have with particular type of puck configuration: puck free in its movements, cloned symmetrically, cloned on the upper level,… (particularly interesting for levels several screens high) Plus a few more flourishes, like a background pattern, a snow effect, a "blind" game (the bricks are there, but invisible, I know it's weird, but so are the convolutions of a Nerdy brain, so, logically…) And certainly lots of other stuff that I must have forgotten to mention and that I let you discover in the (amiga) guides and other documentation.
